items.title: Americans are destroying Flock surveillance cameras
items.creator: Zack Whittaker
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Americans are destroying Flock surveillance cameras

images.alt: A Flock surveillance camera in Houston, Texas, US, on Wednesday, Feb. 4, 2026. Flock counts more than 6,000 customers that are using its license plate readers, camera-equipped drones, gunshot detection devices and software, with customers in every state except Alaska. Photographer: Antranik Tavitian/Bloomberg via Getty Images

items.content: While some cities are moving to end their contracts with Flock over its links to ICE, others are taking matters into their own hands.

items.title: VPN flaws allowed Chinese hackers to compromise dozens of Ivanti customers, says report
items.creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: VPN flaws allowed Chinese hackers to compromise dozens of Ivanti customers, says report

images.alt: A building featuring Ivanti's logo in red on the top of the building.

items.content: Chinese hackers allegedly broke into the network of an Ivanti subsidiary in 2021. The hackers exploited a backdoor in its VPN product, which allowed the hackers to gain access to 119 other unnamed organizations.

items.translated_title: Bill Gurley says that right now, the worst thing you can do for your career is play it safe
items.content: "The number one thing is to get out of your head this ideal that gets passed around in the self-help world: 'go get a mentor,' and everyone runs out and cold calls someone that's ridiculously too high and unachievable, and it doesn't work."

items.title: Quantonation’s double-sized second fund shows quantum still has believers
items.creator: Anna Heim
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Quantonation’s double-sized second fund shows quantum still has believers
items.content: Quantonation Ventures, a venture firm investing in quantum and physics-based startups, has closed its oversubscribed second fund at €220 million, or approximately $260 million. That’s more than twice the size of its inaugural fund, and comes in addition to other signals that the quantum winter isn’t coming yet.
